headline.print_headline: Rubio, in Appeal to G.O.P.’s Conscience, Urges Compromise on Dream Act
headline.seo: Marco Rubio Urges Republicans to Accept Compromise on Dream Act
headline.main: Rubio, in Appeal to G.O.P.’s Conscience, Urges Compromise on Dream Act

docs.snippet: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida urged his party, which is worried about losing Hispanic voters, to allow young illegal immigrants a pathway to legal status....

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Sen Marco Rubio urges Republicans to embrace a compromise measure of the Dream Act, allowing young illegal immigrants a pathway to legal status; Rubio's push comes as Mitt Romney tries to shift from the hard-line stance he took during the primary fight to a softer position that could erode Pres Obama's overwhelming edge with Hispanic voters.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida urged his party, which is worried about losing Hispanic voters, to allow young illegal immigrants a pathway to legal status.

headline.print_headline: A Spate of Teenage Suicides Alarms Russians
headline.seo: In Russia, Spate of Teenage Suicides Causes Alarm
headline.main: A Spate of Teenage Suicides Alarms Russians

docs.snippet: President Dmitri A. Medvedev and experts warned that too much publicity surrounding the deaths might be contributing to a copycat effect....
docs.abstract: Drastic spike in teenage suicides throughout Russia has become so pronounced that Pres Dmitri A Medvedev warns news media outlets that too much publicity surrounding the deaths might be contributing to a copycat effect.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Dmitri A. Medvedev and experts warned that too much publicity surrounding the deaths might be contributing to a copycat effect.

headline.print_headline: Updating a Formula as Stoudemire Returns
headline.seo: Knicks Tweaking Formula as Stoudemire Returns
headline.main: Updating a Formula as Stoudemire Returns

docs.snippet: Amar’e Stoudemire, out the past four weeks with a back injury, is expected to return to the Knicks lineup for Friday’s game against the Cleveland Cavaliers....
docs.abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column on New York Knicks, who are preparing for the return of their star forward Amare Stoudemire; warns that the team's personality has changed in Stoudemire's absence, becoming more methodical on offense and more diligent on defense.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amar’e Stoudemire, out the past four weeks with a back injury, is expected to return to the Knicks lineup for Friday’s game against the Cleveland Cavaliers.

headline.print_headline: Turmoil in Egypt Race Puts Spotlight On Panel’s Motives
headline.seo: Turmoil in Egypt Elections Puts Spotlight On Panel’s Motives
headline.main: Turmoil in Egypt Race Puts Spotlight on Panel’s Motives

docs.snippet: The disqualifications of three leading presidential candidates threw a spotlight on the country’s influential five-member election commission....
docs.abstract: News analysis; disqualifications of three leading presidential candidates in Egypt by the country’s five-member election commission throws the presidential race into a new bout of turmoil and stokes fears that the panel, which has broad powers to oversee the election with virtually no oversight, is being manipulated by the country's military rulers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The disqualifications of three leading presidential candidates threw a spotlight on the country’s influential five-member election commission.

headline.print_headline: Fate of Mixed Martial Arts in New York State Again Rests With Assembly
headline.seo: Fate of Mixed Martial Arts in New York Rests With Assembly
headline.main: Fate of Mixed Martial Arts in New York State Again Rests With Assembly

docs.snippet: The bill, passed in the State Senate for the third consecutive year, would make New York the 46th state to allow the sport....
docs.abstract: New York State Senate passes a bill that would make New York the 46th state to legalize mixed martial arts; is the third consecutive year in which the Senate has approved the legislation, which has subsequently died in the Assembly each time over concerns about the sport's inherent violence.
docs.lead_paragraph: The bill, passed in the State Senate for the third consecutive year, would make New York the 46th state to allow the sport.

headline.print_headline: Jets Look For Boom In Draft, Not Bust
headline.seo: N.F.L. Draft: Jets Are on the Board and on the Fence
headline.main: Jets Look for Boom in Draft, Not Bust

docs.snippet: The Jets, with the 16th pick over all in next week’s N.F.L. draft, would like to improve their pass rush and at offensive tackle, receiver and safety....
docs.abstract: New York Jets will look to improve their outside pass rush in this year's NFL draft.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jets, with the 16th pick over all in next week’s N.F.L. draft, would like to improve their pass rush and at offensive tackle, receiver and safety.

headline.print_headline: In Cellar, Hopes to Solve ‘79 Case of Missing Boy
headline.seo: In Etan Patz Disappearance, Search Is On 33 Years Later
headline.main: In Basement, Hopes to Solve ’79 Case of Missing Boy

docs.snippet: The authorities are digging for remains in the basement of a building near where Etan Patz, 6, vanished as he walked to a school bus stop in the Manhattan neighborhood of SoHo....
docs.abstract: Investigators equipped with jackhammers enter the basement of a building in SoHo, starting the second day of the most extensive search to date for the remains of Etan Patz, a boy whose disappearance more than 30 years ago at age 6 focused national attention on the problem of missing children; investigators are working on the theory that the handyman, Othniel Miller, killed the boy and buried him in the basement where his workshop was.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Joseph Goldstein, Randy Leonard, Christopher Maag and Andy Newman.

docs.lead_paragraph: The authorities are digging for remains in the basement of a building near where Etan Patz, 6, vanished as he walked to a school bus stop in the Manhattan neighborhood of SoHo.

headline.print_headline: Bishop Denies Testimony Alleging He Abused Youth
headline.seo: Bishop Michael J. Bransfield Denies Testimony Alleging He Abused Youth
headline.main: Bishop Denies Testimony Alleging He Abused Youth

docs.snippet: Bishop Michael J. Bransfield denied on Thursday that he had abused children, as alleged by a witness in a trial of other priests in Philadelphia....
docs.abstract: Bishop Michael J Bransfield denies allegations of sex abuse levied against him during court proceedings in trial of other priests in Philadelphia.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bishop Michael J. Bransfield denied on Thursday that he had abused children, as alleged by a witness in a trial of other priests in Philadelphia.

headline.print_headline: American Nuns, Conscience and the Vatican
headline.seo: American Nuns, Conscience and the Vatican
headline.main: American Nuns, Conscience and the Vatican

docs.snippet: It would be a great loss if the voices of America’s nuns were restricted by the Vatican’s inquiry into their leadership conference....

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes the Vatican for attempting to rein in the advocacy work done by the Leadership conference of Women Religious, largely because of its support for Pres Obama's health care reform law; holds American nuns are clearly caught in a crossfire of church doctrine, politics and hierarchical obedience.
docs.lead_paragraph: It would be a great loss if the voices of America’s nuns were restricted by the Vatican’s inquiry into their leadership conference.
